meanings.definition: To summarize or condense into a concise form.
meanings.sent1: I need to capsulize the main points of the story for my presentation.
meanings.sent2: She always capsulizes her thoughts before writing an essay.
meanings.sent3: Trying to capsulize a whole book into a paragraph is quite a challenge!
meanings.sent4: Her ability to capsulize complex ideas is like fitting a puzzle into a tiny box.
meanings.sent5: Let me capsulize the instructions so you can easily follow them.

meanings.definition: To encapsulate or enclose in a capsule.
meanings.sent1: The scientist will capsulize the medicine for easy consumption.
meanings.sent2: He decided to capsulize the important documents for safekeeping.
meanings.sent3: It's like a magic trick to capsulize a whole meal into a single pill!
meanings.sent4: Her love was so strong, it felt like he could capsulize it in his heart.
meanings.sent5: The capsule machine will capsulize the powder into small pills.
